creator: nettings@apache.org
text:
many users report spurious validation errors when using the XHTML doctype,
especially when using it with advanced editors such as FCK or TinyMCE.
for some reason the XHTML doctype only allows a subset of the XHTML spec without
ever saying so.
this should be fixed for 1.4.

Can't we postpone that to 1.4.1? I have the feeling that it might not be as easy
as one might think, especially because various editors are involved.
creator: andreas@apache.org

text:
+1
i think we have to, because i've run into no end of problems with bxe...

tinymce otoh will not work very well with just xhtml-basic.
if there was a stable xhtml backend format, i could write pre- and
post-processing transformations for tiny, but as it is now it's kinda a moving
target.

<grammar ...
<include href="fallback://lenya/resources/schemas/lenya.rng"/>

...

now when i open bxe and try to make a word italic, bxe's client-side validator
